summary: This is a court order and email correspondence regarding the case USA v. Maxwell. The court orders the parties to propose redactions to a sealed government motion to quash a defense subpoena. The defense indicates they have no redactions to propose.

persons.context: A member of the defense counsel who responded to the court's order, stating the defense has no redactions to propose.

events.title: Court Order on Motion to Quash
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issues an order regarding the government's sealed motion to quash a defense subpoena, setting a deadline for proposed redactions.

events.title: Deadline for Proposed Redactions
events.description: The court-ordered deadline for parties to file any proposed redactions to the sealed government motion.

locations: U.S. District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The government filed a motion to quash a defense subpoena issued by Ghislaine Maxwell under Rule 17(c)(3), which was temporarily filed under seal.
The court ordered the parties to propose limited redactions to the sealed motion by November 22, 2021, justifying them under the legal standard from Lugosch v. Pyramid Co.
The defense, via counsel 'Chris', stated they had no redactions to propose in response to the court's order.
The document shows extensive legal representation for Ghislaine Maxwell, with multiple attorneys and law firms receiving notice of the filing.
The case is USA v. Maxwell, case number 1:20-cr-00330-AJN, being heard in the Southern District of New York.
